revised_title: Immunohistochemical Identification of Dopaminergic Neurons in Rat Superior Cervical Ganglion
tldr: The author used a double-staining immunohistochemical technique to investigate the distribution of catecholamine synthesizing enzymes in the rat superior cervical ganglion. They discovered two types of dopaminergic cells: small to medium-sized ganglion neurons and small cells resembling small intensely fluorescent (s.i.f.) cells. These findings provide evidence that a small proportion of catecholaminergic sympathetic neurons use dopamine as their neurotransmitter.
